entry.title: UI Configuration of screen behavior in 'Create new' screen in FIORI
entry.content:
Hi experts,
I am working on a modification of a screen in FIORI which is actually to change the behavior to work same as any CR Types - "Create new material"(Material Data Management).
Coming to the point, for a standard CR types - create new screen then filling mandatory field and then directly if we click on 'cancel button' it gives a pop up waring-> OK and then navigates to another screen(non-editable screen), further we get 'continue' button. And when it is clicked it takes back to "Create new screen again".
But incase some of our ZM CR types(Manage Front number, Manage Middle group, Mange description catalogue ) it works same till cancel button but after clicking on cancel button it navigates to a different screen(editable screen) without a "Continue button".
I am trying to know how can we change the screen behavior so that it will work same as like in "Create new material" standard process, or where can I check to compare this difference and replicate the same in our ZM CR-types scenario.
I have attached two screenshots to compare both above mentioned scenarios.
Best Regards,
Sagar

We have upgraded our mdg system fps 1909 to 2023. after upgrade the standard UIBBs like ERP vendor and ERP customer are not visible while maintaining the data using CR in fiori. we did not enhance these UIBBs with any custom fields. We have two custom handler classes but they are related to different UIBBs not related to ERP vendor or customer.

please let me know the root cause of this problem.

Thanks, Srikanth

Will there be any impact.

Regards,

SP

Sales org derived(Distribution Chains) and also the relevant tax classification(Standard) in Distribution Chain: Tax .

So, how could i read the MLANSALES entity?

 

regards

Chandra.

entry.title: Key Mapping in SAP MDG
entry.content:
SAP Master Data Governance 

the management of different number ranges for different target systems in an SAP MDG Hub Deployment is a standard requirement and is primarily achieved using the System-Specific Number Range Definition and the Key Mapping functionality.

The goal is to allow the MDG Hub to create a master data record (e.g., Business Partner/Customer/Supplier) with its own number, while the target systems receive a different, local number upon replication.

Here is the standard Configuration :

 MDG Hub Numbering vs. Target System Numbering

In an MDG Hub deployment, the MDG system assigns the Central Governance ID (the unique master data key) for the record. For replication to a target system with a different number range,

 

  1. MDG Hub: Typically use Internal Number Assignment for the Business Partner (BP) in the MDG system itself. The BP number range is configured in the Hub using transaction SNRO for the object BU_PARTNER.
  2. Target ERP System: The corresponding number range for the Customer/Vendor/Material in the target system must be configured for External Number Assignment. This allows the target system to accept the different number that will be derived during replication.

 

 Configuration for Target System Number Ranges

SAP MDG provides specific Customizing activities to define the number range that should be used by the target system for a replicated record, based on its Account Group or Material Type.

Go the  transaction MDGIMG

 (or SPRO under Master Data Governance → Central Governance → [MDG for Business Partner / Customer / Supplier]).

  1. Number Range Derivation per Target System

This configuration allows you to override the standard number that would be derived in the target system.

  • For Customer/Supplier: Use the Customizing activity:
    • Define Number Ranges for [Customer/Supplier] Account Groups per Target System.
    • In this table, you map the Account Group (or Customer/Supplier Account Group) to the Target System (or Logical System) and assign a specific Number Range Key (Group) that the target system must use for that combination.
  1. Replication of the New Number

When the approved Change Request is replicated using the Data Replication Framework (DRF):

  • The replication service reads the configuration defined in Step A.
  • It determines the correct Target System Number Range (Group) based on the target system and the account group of the master data object.
  • The target system's number logic will then apply the external number assignment logic using that configured group/range key.

 

Key Mapping for Synchronization

Key Mapping is essential to ensure that the unique MDG Hub number is correctly linked to the unique number in each target system.

  • Purpose: The Key Mapping Table stores the relationship between the MDG ID and the corresponding local ID in all connected target systems.
  • Configuration: Key Mapping is configured under MDGIMG → General Settings → Key Mapping → Define Key Mapping (or transaction IDMIMG).
  • Usage:
    • When the record is replicated to Target System A, the local number A is generated and stored in the Key Mapping table alongside the MDG Hub ID.
    • When the record is replicated to Target System B, the local number B is generated (based on its number range) and also stored in the Key Mapping table, linked to the same MDG Hub ID.

This ensures that the MDG system can always look up the correct local number to use for updates or lookups in any specific target system.

entry.title: MDG Supplier – WS54300005 BRF+ DT_SINGLE_VAL_SUPPL1P1
entry.content:
Bonjour à tous,

Je configure SAP MDG pour les fournisseurs sur S/4HANA et je suis bloqué avec le flux de travail basé sur des règles pour le type de demande de modification SUPPL1P1 (Créer un fournisseur).

Le modèle de flux de travail est WS54300005 (MDG : Créer un fournisseur) et l'application BRF+ est USMD_SSW_CATA_SUPPL1P1 .

1. Ce que j'ai configuré

  1. Type de demande de modification

    • Type de CR : SUPPL1P1

    • Les types d'entités, leur périmètre et leurs activités commerciales sont gérés dans SPRO :

      • Types d'entités : BP_HEADER, BP_REL, ADDRNO

      • Activité commerciale : SUP1 – Créer un fournisseur

    • L'accord de niveau de service et les autres paramètres CR sont conservés.

  2. Détermination du flux de travail/agent

    • Le flux de travail basé sur des règles est activé pour SUPPL1P1.

    • Le modèle de flux de travail WS54300005 est attribué.

    • Dans la transaction PFTC , j'ai défini les tâches MDG concernées sur « Tâche générale » .

  3. BRF+ (Application USMD_SSW_CATA_SUPPL1P1)

    Dans la section Tableaux de décision, j'ai :

    • DT_USER_AGT_GRP_SUPPL1P1 (Table de décision de l'agent utilisateur)

      • Plusieurs lignes avec Condition Alias =1​​​​, =3,=5

      • Numéro de groupe d'agent utilisateur =001

      • Type d'étape = 2(Approuver la demande de modification), 4(Réviser), 5(Activer)

      • Type d'agent utilisateur =US (User)

      • Valeur de l'agent utilisateur = mon utilisateur SKATYS_ILYS

    • DT_NON_USER_AGT_GRP_SUPPL1P1 (Groupe d'agents non-utilisateurs)

      • Alias =2​​​​, =4, =6, =8, =9pour les étapes techniques (activation / achèvement / restauration, etc.)

      • Tous avec le groupe d'agents = 001.

    • DT_SINGLE_VAL_SUPPL1P1 (Tableau de décision à valeur unique)
      Au départ, ce tableau était vide et la fonction Check a généré les erreurs suivantes :

      • DT_SINGLE_VAL_SUPPL1P1 (Expression) : Entrée requise dans la colonne 'DemModif.étape préc.' (PREVIOUS_STEP) manquante.

      • Contrôles de domaine pour CR_REASON (USMD211C) et CR_REASON_REJ (USMD212C) .

      J'ai ensuite ajouté des lignes.
      Voici le contenu actuel (simplifié) :

      Étape précédente de la demande de modification : Action précédente : Priorité de la demande de modification : Raison de la demande de modification : Raison du rejet de la CR : Alias ​​​​de la condition : Nouvelle étape de la demande de modification
      =00… (vidéo)………190
      =90=04 (Rejeter)………395

      Le tableau est enregistré, vérifié et activé . L'application et l'ensemble de règles sont également actifs (statut vert).

2. Symptôme

Lorsque je crée une demande de modification fournisseur ( application Fiori – « Traitement de la demande de modification » / Process Supplier Change Requests ) :

  • La demande de changement (CR) a été créée correctement avec le statut « Flux de travail en cours » .

  • Dans la boîte de réception MDG (Fiori Ma boîte de réception), je ne reçois aucun élément de travail à approuver .

  • Dans la transaction SWI1 , je ne vois que le sous-workflow WS54300005 avec le statut Erreur et aucun élément de travail de dialogue.

Captures d'écran (en pièce jointe) :

  1. La demande de modification indique « Workflow en cours de traitement ».

  2. SWI1 – uniquement WS54300005 avec statut Erreur.

  3. Journal de flux de travail :

    • Les étapes « Définir le statut 1 pour la demande de changement », « Vérifier la demande de changement » et « Obtenir le filtre d'agent » sont terminées .

    • Il n'y a pas d'étape « Approuver la demande de modification… » et le flux de travail se termine immédiatement.

  4. Affichage « Agents de workflow » : je vois SAP_WFRT et mon utilisateur SKATYS_ILYS uniquement pour l'événement de démarrage.

Le filtre de l'agent BRF+ est donc exécuté , mais il semble qu'aucune ligne de DT_SINGLE_VAL_SUPPL1P1 ne corresponde , par conséquent aucune étape utilisateur n'est créée.

entry.title: BP Data Model Extension - FPM List UIBB is not working on the Customer Creation Screen
entry.content:
Hi,

1. We have created custom Type 4 Entity under BP_HEADER Node. we need store this data in the standard Table UKMBP_CMS_SGM.

2. Added List UIBB to the screen, placed Edit and New Buttons on the screen. Used Custom Feeder Class which extends CL_BS_BP_GUIBB_LIST.

3. Genil Enhancement created with Custom Genil class which extends CL_BS_GENIL_CUSTOMER.

Issue: We are getting the Table on the screen,

New Button - is visible but not working.

Edit Button - Not visible at all.

Thanks,

Prasad.

entry.content:

There is an already existing CR for customer change which has got approval process associated with it.
How to achieve the requirement without hampering the existing process.
Please note sender system can send only the VAT number.

entry.title: SAP Public Cloud 2508 / Errors during the Mass Creation of Business Partner Relationships
entry.content:
Hello Experts,
we have the following issue during the migration of 2000 Business Partner relationships.
We are using the app  "Manage Mass Creation Processes - BP Relationships (F6560A)" to import BP-Relationships for existing Business Partners.
We split the import into batches of 500, but if we try to activate these, then the system activates 100 of those and then gives the following error:
"User SAP_WFRT is processing the business partners relationship XY"
The error counter varies, if you reprocess the activation, sometimes it goes up one or two, then it drops down, till it activates another 100 entries. Eventually it activates all 500, so we were able to import the first batch. All of this takes a lot of time.

Our question is, is this standard behavior ? Can the tool only import 100 relationships at once and then needs time to process some stuff in the background ? 

We appreciate and advice on how to improve this process.
Best regards
Lukas

entry.title: SAP Public Cloud 2508 / Mass Maintenance of Tax classification
entry.content:
Hello Experts,
i have the following issue. During the migration of customers, the information for the tax classification was filled incorrectly into the migration template and migrated with the migration cockpit
All entries consist of a country code, the tax category (mainly TTX1) and the tax classification (1 or 0). 
Because of an human error, many entries have a variety of country codes, when they all should only have one specific country code.
As a result none of these entries are displayed in the app "manage business partner master data" under the sales area section.

If i manually edit those business partners, i can add an entry with the correct country code, that overwrites the wrong entry that is not visible.
So far i have looked into the mass maintenance tool, but there i can only change the tax classification to a different value, but not the country code, which is the incorrect entry.
I also looked into the app "mass import of business partner master data", but there i get a message that the fields i want to import (correct) are alread filled.

The table that contains this data is called "KNVI".

My question is, is there way to do this correction in mass ? Can i update these entries with the migration cockpit or did i miss another option ?

Best regards 
Lukas

entry.title: How to register in MDG key mapping table
entry.content:
To link key codes registered in S/4HANA with key codes in peripheral systems, I would like to bulk register them in the MDG key mapping table using a CSV file.

The codes to be registered are item codes and business partner codes. In this case, I would like to know the mapping data structure of the input CSV file (what fields are required in the CSV file).

Next, we plan to create an add-on program that will register data in the MDG key mapping table using the ADD_MATCHING method of CL_MDG_ID_MATCHING_API_BS.

I would like to know what parameters are required when calling this class, since the values ​​for KeySchemaID and KeyAgencyID are managed internally by the system.

I need your help.

Thank you in advance.

Custom FPM screen populated

entry.title: Auto extend plant to a material SAP MDG
entry.content:
My requirement is to auto extend a plant to a material CR

Background 

I am creating a follow-up cr where I want to auto add new plants when the CR is opened

i have written the code in system method caller badi as I am creating follow up cr by code

I have use Governance API but new plants are not getting added and there is no error as well.

And if I am making changes to existing data it is working fine but when I am trying to add new plant data it is not working

 

I tried to modify ct_data as well of plant feeder class but encountering same issue

please suggest
